701465f-a.title: Bronx: Montgomery Avenue - 176th Street (West)
701465f-a.text:
Montgomery Avenue, west side, just south of W.176th Street,
showing the Mongomery house, view 2 showing also the stable
or servants' quarters. This area was later built up with
apartment houses. Montgomery Avenue is on the left(view2),
running south from 176th Street.
E. P. Chrystie  May 30, 1923
RELIT LDIE LPERATIVE  Views 1,2

701466f-b.title: Bronx: Montgomery Avenue - 176th Street (West)
701466f-b.text:
Montgomery Avenue, east side, just north of W.176th Street, showing
the stone stable on the Lewis G. Morris estate,known as Mount
Fordham. The area was later built dp with apartment houses.
The Lerwin Manor and the Salson now stand here, the latter being
on Andrews Avenue.
E. P. Chrystie  May 30, 1923
;RECIT LINE IRPERATIVE  Views 1,2

Montgomery Avenue, east side, just north of W.176th Street, showing

701467f-b.title: Bronx: Montgomery Avenue - 176th Street (West)
701467f-b.text:
(1)
1770 Montgomery Ave., east side, between West 176th Street and
West Tremont Ave., showing "Mount Fordham', the Lewis G. Morris
Mansion. It was built about 1830 and demolished between 1915 and
1924. The G.W. Bromley map of 1924 as revised to September 1932
shows the site to be occupied by a 6-story apartment house bearing
the above number. The exact spot of "Mount Fordham" is the north
rear wall of the apartment house and the twenty-five foot yard
adjoining it.
1911.
Gift of Randall Comfort.
